message: /* Anti-Semitism dispute */ Moved references to the end of the sentence. Shortened the sentence for concision.
No consensus for previous version. Neutrality issues. Updated citations.
Too slanted and poor word economy. Reinstated the previous, more concise and neutral version. Updated citations and templates again for verification. Please use talk page to avoid edit warring.
/* Early life */ Moved "Brahmin family" to different sentence
/* Anti-Semitism row */ Reinstated the previous, more concise neutral version. Updated citations.
/* Commission on Race and Ethnic Disparities */ removed sentence - no source
/* Criticism of David Abulafia and claim of anti-Semitism */ updated information and phrasing
/* Criticism of David Abulafia and claim of anti-Semitism */ added information
fixed broken link. removed internal link

Undid revision 1032352127 by [[Special:Contributions/Xxanthippe|Xxanthippe]] ([[User talk:Xxanthippe|talk]]) The wiki editor is not casting judgement. Gopal has stated that she is a Brahmin and comes from a Brahmin family. The citation is unambiguously explicit about this.
/* Churchill, empire and race */ merged sentences
/* Colonialism */ Changed title to fit section content and added more detail.
Moved 'Churchill, empire and race' from 'Race' to 'Empire' section as it is closer to it in theme. Also added more detail to the section.
Section on the Race report updated to include expert/scholarly criticism. Gopal's criticism is in line with what was canvassed on her article.
Section updated to include expert/scholarly criticism of Empire project.
Reverted edit by Ohnoitsjamie - see WP:DNRNC and recent comments in talk page. Please refrain from edit warring.
Reverted edit by [[User:Xxanthippe|Xxanthippe]] - see WP:DNRNC and comments in talk page (posted at 06:09, 5 May 2021 (UTC)). Please refrain from edit warring.
Revert to 3 May version - See WP:DNRNC and talk page.
Removed The Times and Aaronovitch's personal attacks - there is no consensus for its inclusion. Other editors have already raised concerns over its use in the article.
Added precision, balance and context to Sewell section.

Undid most of the revision by Pikavoom. Unclear how the edit does not accurately capture the 'controversies' Gopal is involved with. Revision summary gave no adequate explanation other than 'promotional'. The section complies with WP:NPOV and WP:V
Reworded Sewell section to bring it in line with WP:V policy - previous section reinstated without consensus. Regarding the 'Controversies' section, see my comments in Talk.

Reworded Sewell section to bring it in line with WP:V policy. RM subjective expressions from lead: please avoid using value-laden expressions such as whether something positive and negative. It is for the reader to ascertain and determine what is good, bad, indifferent etc. They should not get presented with a binary choice. Regarding the 'Media attention' section, see my comments in Talk.

Undid revision by [[User:15|15]].  [[User:15|15]], Yes. I guess it's easier to believe it's a comparison when intellectual honesty and rigour are replaced by letting others do your 'thinking' for you. Regarding the section heading, see my comments in Talk. At this point, happy to keep reverting edits that are malign and foolish, though I will yield if there's a broad consensus among respected and experienced editors.
Undid revision 1019246962 by [[Special:Contributions/15|15]] ([[User talk:15|talk]])[[User:15|15]], that's not an argument or refutation. Try engaging with the substance of what I said.

Reinstated title change. It's unclear why [[User:Lajmmoore|Lajmmoore]]'s title change got removed. 'Controversies' is a false framing of the issues at play and does not reflect WP:NPOV. The most neutral descriptor seems to be 'Media Attention'. The relentless pushing of a partisan POV by repeatedly adding Aaronovitch's and The Times personal attacks is also a blatant contravention of WP:NPOV. Changed wording of preamble to bring statement in line with WP:NPOV policy.

Tony Sewell section: Wording needs more care. Gopal did not compare Sewell to Goebbels, as some media outlets have incorrectly reported. Gopal has stated explicitly that her remark was a reference, not a comparison - see talkRADIO interview with Nick de Bois. Moreover, it reads like a reference, not a comparison. Happy to initiate a factual review. Added sentence. Important to frame comments within the report's context and reactions to it. Merging it with another sentence obfuscates this.
Doubling up of information in Lead and Work section. Moved op-eds to External Links.
Undid revision 1018856132 by [[Special:Contributions/Pikavoom|Pikavoom]] ([[User talk:Pikavoom|talk]]) no consensus for preceding edits by Atchom and others.

Tony Sewell section: Wording needs more care. Gopal did not compare Tony Sewell to Joseph Goebbels, as some media outlets have incorrectly reported. Gopal has stated explicitly that her remark was a reference, not a comparison - see talkRADIO interview with Nick de Bois. Moreover, it reads like a reference, not a comparison, which is factually incorrect. Added sentence. Important to frame comments within the report's context and reactions to it. Merging it with another sentence obfuscates this.

Controversies section: Reinstated [[User:Lajmmoore|Lajmmoore]]'s edit: Retitled section to 'Media Attention'. 'Controversies' is a loaded and problematic term. Removing it moves us closer to NPOV. Also removed media slurs and changed wording of preamble to bring statement in line with NPOV policy.

Goppal made a reference to Goebbels, not a comparison - see my previous edit summaries. Added sentence - important to frame comments within the report's context and reactions to it. Merging it with another sentence obfuscates this. RM 'both positive and negative' from lead - this is self evident.
Reverted edit on Criticism of Tony Sewell, cleaned up references

Undid revision 1017502206 by [[Special:Contributions/Xxanthippe|Xxanthippe]] ([[User talk:Xxanthippe|talk]]) Undo of revert as unjustified. There was no editorialising in the previous revision. It was edited for accuracy and context. External links were updated as well.

Gopal made a reference to Goebbels, not a comparison. It's a matter of accuracy, not proprietary or original thought - see my previous edit summary.  Added sentence - important to frame comments within the report's context and reactions to it. Merging it with another sentence obfuscates this. RM 'both positive and negative' - this is self evident. Added External links

Gopal corrected a talkRADIO presenter - this is hardly a bad look. She explicitly stated it was a reference. She is entitled to have her views presented in the form they were intended to be read. Moreover, it reads like a reference, not a comparison - it is a failure of comprehension to suggest otherwise. The fact that The Times reported it as a comparison is neither here nor there. It is a mistake to abandon one's own intellectual judgment to others.
See edit summary in previous revision

Adding sentence. Important to frame comments within the report's context and reactions to it. Furthermore, it is a failure of comprehension to say that Gopal compared Sewell to Goebbels. It was a reference. Lazy and loaded reporting stating it was a comparison is irrelevant. Even Gopal has stated that the tweet was a reference to Sewell, not a comparison - see ref 66

Adding newspapers and publications in lede. Lede's should define the subject and their work. Gopal has provided media commentary and contributed to a range of publications for many years, most notably The Guardian. I have included references to column archives. A more extensive list can be found in the External Links. Lede sentence 'involved in a number of public controversies concerning racial issues' is loaded. Reworded to be more neutral.
I have updated the section to include more emphasis on the report.
Wording needs more care. Gopal made a reference to Goebbels, not a comparison. Also important to note that experts criticised the report. Multiple publications reported this - reference added.
Periodicals are also the source of her notability. Adding back in lead.
Removing 'and elsewhere' - no reliable, published sources provided. Added Times reference.
Wording needs more care. Gopal's tweet pointed out that 'Even Dr Goebbels had a research PhD.' This is a reference to Goebbels, not a comparison. Added context.

This is a passing commentary on an aspect of a broader issue that a few media outlets, primarily tabloids, reported. It does not warrant its own section. Additionally, Gopal did not compare Tony Sewell to Joseph Goebbels, as some media outlets have incorrectly reported. Her tweet pointed out that 'Even Dr Goebbels had a research PhD.' That is a reference to Goebbels, not a comparison.
Updated citation template for podcast references
Updated introduction and External links. Removed website from Infobox as it is already cited in References and External Links.

Removed 'Selected journalism' section. Apropos Philip Cross's recent edit, this article relies excessively on sources that refer to work by Professor Gopal, potentially compromising its neutrality. I have removed 9 of the 22 citations that refer to the subjects work. Additionally, articles referenced in 'Selected journalism' can be accessed via the Column archives in the 'External links' section.
Removed external links that cover the same subject matter.

Again, the statement I deleted implies that Gopal was suspended for her initial tweet. This is not the case. The source I provided states that she was suspended for making her hate mail public. Gopal has publicly confirmed this. Also deleted unnecessary information - statements of support/condemnation. Let's keep this concise and on-point.

The deleted statement is misleading. It implies that Gopal was suspended because she tweeted "White lives don't matter. As white lives" - this is incorrect. She was briefly suspended from Twitter after sharing some of the messages of racist abuse and death threats she received following the tweet. Please refer to the following article: https://www.varsity.co.uk/news/19542
Global politics section removed. Needs to be more expansive - please revise/redo
ISBN's moved to the References section
Re. Abulafia, anti-Semitism section: Incorporated segments from previous version. Replaced citations, which are verifiable and relevant to the section. Refer to talk page for relevant discussion.

Undid revision 1066850179 by [[Special:Contributions/Artemis Seeker|Artemis Seeker]] ([[User talk:Artemis Seeker|talk]]) Let's keep the section succinct. Long, rambling sentences are not helpful. Also removed citation & fixed grammar.

/* Criticism of David Abulafia and claim of anti-Semitism */ The criticism implied that her remarks are anti-Semitic - added this back. 'Attack' too strong - changed to 'story'. Trimmed back - previous versions too bloated
reverted. previous version is an accurate account of events and did not call for a wholesale revert, though some changes required.
/* Empire */ Adding reference to Empire, wording
/* Early life */ removed fluff. shortened sentence.
moved Times quote to relevant section. The quote is from an article about the King's College incident

removed trivial disputes, undue weight in article

Undid revision 1096538649 by [[Special:Contributions/Xxanthippe|Xxanthippe]] ([[User talk:Xxanthippe|talk]]) I was under the impression that wiki is open open to all. I have tried to collaborate but you seem intent on gatekeeping crude and insulting content.

Actually, I don't think that description ("victim with a persecution complex") summarises the article's content. A good lead summarises the subject's notability in fair, neutral and accurate terms. I'm not interested in edit warring and believe we can find a consensus. I have updated the lead using less crude & inflammatory language.

I have not removed the extract; it remains in the King's section - I don't know why the article repeats it. But the lead should maintain a neutral tone, it's not a battleground. "Victim with a persecution complex" is provocative & unnecessary. It would be better to use a formal, dispassionate tone in the lead to maintain the article's neutrality. note: I made the last edit.
context; the extract is in the King's section

Undid revision 1118914719 by [[Special:Contributions/CAVincent|CAVincent]] ([[User talk:CAVincent|talk]]) The critique is from a reliable source and comes from an academic who has produced peer-reviewed work on empire. You can't suppress this from the article because you want to protect Ferguson from criticism. Stop edit warring.
